Convert between ANOVA effect sizes

Source: R/convert_between_anova.R
eta2_to_f2.Rd

Convert between ANOVA effect sizes

eta2_to_f2(es)

eta2_to_f(es)

f2_to_eta2(f2)

f_to_eta2(f)

Arguments

es

Any measure of variance explained such as Eta-, Epsilon-, Omega-, or R-Squared, partial or otherwise. See details.
f, f2

Cohen's f or f-squared.

Details

Any measure of variance explained can be converted to a corresponding Cohen's f via:
$$\text{Cohen's }f^2 = \frac{\eta^2}{1 - \eta^2}$$
$$\eta^2 = \frac{f^2}{1 + f^2}$$

If a partial Eta-Squared is used, the resulting Cohen's f is a partial-Cohen's f; If a less biased estimate of variance explained is used (such as Epsilon- or Omega-Squared), the resulting Cohen's f is likewise a less biaed estimate of Cohen's f.

References

  • Cohen, J. (1988). Statistical power analysis for the behavioral sciences (2nd Ed.). New York: Routledge.

  • Steiger, J. H. (2004). Beyond the F test: Effect size confidence intervals and tests of close fit in the analysis of variance and contrast analysis. Psychological Methods, 9, 164-182.

See also

eta_squared() for more details.

Other convert between effect sizes: d_to_common_language(), d_to_r(), odds_to_probs(), oddsratio_to_riskratio()
